div.p: Results from the qualitative evaluation phase

td.span: Experience of change in attitudes and communication behaviors

tr.td: “I pay more attention to the way I steer my consultations. Previously, I have probably paid no attention to this, at all, in stressful situations. But now I try to reflect: Was this ok, the way I steered this consultation?” (P4)

td.span: Satisfaction with the training and its components

tr.td: „I am grateful. It was a great opportunity to perform these [simulated patient] situations and receive supervision. You hardly ever get this opportunity as a physician in outpatient care or in hospital.“(P8)

„I would say, analysis [of simulated patient consultations] in general and then the video-analysis, during which you see your own reactions and how you behave, and receive feedback from others watching this.” (P19)

td.span: Recommendation to a friend or colleague

tr.td: „It depends on the person and his or her level of training. I would recommend it to beginners, but not necessarily to the more experienced.” (P20)

td.span: Suggestions for improvement of the training

tr.td: „You know, to get the picture, you would have to accompany a physician during his consultation hours. You see, a simulated consultation with an actor is beneficial in some way, but it doesn’t correspond to the reality we have to face.” (P4)

div.p: P1-P22 in brackets = physicians who participated in the qualitative evaluation
